intro: Taraxacum litigiosum, commonly known as the bristly dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant features a hairy stem and basal leaves that are typically lanceolate and serrated. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in early spring, followed by the formation of a distinctive pappus-equipped seed head. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and gardens.
